oai_dc:dc.dc:title: BOUNDARY CONDITIONS IN FINITE ELEMENT MODELING OF STRATIFIED COASTAL CIRCULATION
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Christodoulou, George C.
Economou, George D.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: boundary condition
finite element modeling
stratified coastal water
coastal circulation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The effect of boundary conditions on numerical computations of stratified flow in coastal waters is examined. Clamped, free radiation and sponge layer conditions are implemented in a two-layer finite element model and the results of simple tests in a two-layer stratified basin are presented.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 21 (1988): Proceedings of 21st Conference on Coastal Engineering, Torremolinos, Spain, 1988.; 190
